mode.description: The rendering mode. `none` disables rendering. `fftconv2p` uses 2D FFT convolution renderer.

render_size.description: Specifies to render the images fully or in tiles. This allows for large images that cannot fit in memory. Set to `full` to render images in one piece. Specify tile size [hight, width] to render images in tiles.

spacial_osf.description: The spacial oversampling factor. Note reduce this value to speed up rendering or fix out of memory errors. Should be an odd integer.

padding.description: The image padding amount in pixels. This allows for objects to be rendered outside the image bounds.

samples.description: The number of samples to simulate.

star_render_mode.description: The star rendering mode. `fft` uses FFT convolution renderer and all stars will have save the same streak shape. `transform` uses discrete transform renderer. `transform` is more computationally expensive with many stars.

show_obs_boxes.description: Show observation boxes in annotated images.

show_star_boxes.description: Show star boxes in annotated images.

num_shot_noise_samples.description: The number of shot noise samples to average. This provides shot noise statistics similar to averaging multiple images.

star_catalog_query_mode.description: The star catalog query mode. `at_start` queries the catalog only for the first frame. `frame` queries the catalog for each frame.

num_target_samples.description: The number of target positions to sample. 2 produces a straight line and 3 produces a quadratic curve.

calculate_snr.description: Calculate the SNR for each target pixel. This is a computationally expensive operation.

save_movie.description: Save annotate movie as animated PNG.

save_czml.description: Save CZML file for 3D visualization in Cesium.

star_annotation_threshold.description: The star annotation threshold. This is the minimum visual magnitude for a star to be annotated. `false` disables star annotation.

save_segmentation.description: Save star and object segmenation annotation. Each star and object will have a unique ID for a collect.

psf_sample_frequency.description: The frequency to regenerate a new PSF. Useful when turbulant_atmosphere should be resampled. Valid values: once, collect, frame

save_pickle.description: Save intermediate data as pickle files for debugging.

czml_samples.description: The number of object position samples to save in the CZML file.
